korean: 날씨 예보를 못 봐서 우산을 안 챙겼는데 갑자기 비가 왔다.
아침엔 날씨 괜찮아 보여서 그냥 나왔거든.
점심 먹으러 나가는데 빗방울이 떨어지기 시작했어.
처음엔 조금 올까 했는데 갑자기 쏟아지더라.
집에는 우산이 한 10개는 있는 것 같은데 막상 필요할 때 없다.
신발이랑 바지 다 젖어서 진짜 짜증났어.
다음엔 가방에 작은 우산을 넣어 다녀야겠다.
근데 또 까먹을 것 같긴 해.
저녁에 집 가면서도 비 와서 아까 산 우산 또 썼어. 그래도 오늘은 쓸모 있었네.
english: I didn't check the weather forecast and didn't bring an umbrella, then it suddenly rained.
The weather looked fine in the morning, so I just left without one.
I was heading out for lunch when raindrops started falling.
At first I thought it'd just be a light drizzle, but then it just poured down.
I ran into a convenience store and bought a plastic umbrella.
It was 3000 won, which is kinda pricey, but I mean, what choice did I have?
I think I have about 10 umbrellas at home, but when I need one, I don't have it.
My shoes and pants got all wet and honestly, I was so annoyed.
I dried my shoes with the hand dryer in the office bathroom.
Next time, I should keep a small umbrella in my bag.
But like, I'll probably forget again anyway.
It was still raining on my way home, so I used the umbrella I bought earlier. At least it was useful today.
